channel.title: Suggestion [Pole]
channel.description:
Hi everyone, lately I've been thinking about how the system works on the site. If we want or need a topic to be closed or locked we have to contact a moderator or report our own post to ask. I think it would be a lot simpler if we could lock our own topics, that was if we see the topic is going in the wrong direction, or we simply are ending a project/question, we can just have it die off and not be bumped later on by a random person.
Simple version: [i]Users able to lock own topics.[/i] Simple expected results: [i]Less grave digging, and topics getting way off topic.[/i]
/Opinions, revisions, or idea below.

item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:434781”][quote author=xxlukexx link=topic=537497.msg3930344#msg3930344 date=1330628011]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=537497.msg3930323#msg3930323 date=1330625620]

I actually think the development teams board was set up like that at one point…
[/quote]Yea it was.

Personally I see this as being abused by people to lock their own topics in the case of arguments, etc. I can’t really see the pro’s to this besides maybe less gravedigging (though I don’t know how many times we need to say this, but gravedigging isn’t an issue unless the reply is spam). Topics that go offtopic shouldn’t be locked unless it’s gone offtopic for a real reason (like it shouldn’t have been made in the first place, or it’s completely exhausted all real discussion), in which case it’s currently handled fine.

The reasons people want topics locked are usually trivial like ‘question answered’, and there is no real reason to lock topics like that. As Silabsoft would say, having a bunch of locked topics covering the boards looks like shit.

How is that a con? Id consider that as a good thing.

Also, maybe something to consider instead of “having a bunch of locked topics covering the boards looks like shit.” is being able to delete your own threads.
[/quote]Someone getting angry at someone and locking their topic to get the last word is not a good thing, it means the argument will just continue somewhere else.

The main reason I see this as implausible is because it affects people other than yourself. This is why MITB did have people able to moderate their own threads in development teams, because you owned the team and if you wanted to get rid of it, you could. Giving people this power anywhere is a very bad idea. What if the owner of the IRL pictures thread suddenly decided to delete the post?
[/quote]
